experiences.title: Senior Consultant - Data Engineer
experiences.description:
• Reduced ELT Pipeline time by 65% by creating, optimizing, and deploying 6 new ELT Pipelines in Azure Synapse from previously existing 400 ELT Pipelines in Azure Data Factory for an Indian multinational corporation. Used hash clustering and query optimization techniques to achieve faster data processing.
•	Implemented data orchestration and transformation workflows using Azure Databricks, enhancing data processing efficiency and enabling advanced analytics for actionable insights.
• Created dynamic stored procedures for incremental and truncate loads. Implemented count log mechanism and error log mechanism for data validation.
• Built new features in SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) for a US based client by performing ETL operations, filtering operations in stored procedures and using DAX, MDX Queries in SQL Server Analytics Services (SSAS) cube.
• Migrated SSRS reports to PowerBI paginated reports and SQL stored procedures to Pyspark on Databricks Platform.
• Handled troubleshooting requests for large dataset containing more than 10 million rows and from different data sources and connectors by analyzing fault in queries by running SQL Profiler.
• Lead a team of four to build the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL and Azure big data technologies
•	Executed successful migration projects, moving on-premise data solutions to the Azure cloud, resulting in improved scalability, reliability, and cost-effectiveness.
•	Devised and implemented a series of dashboards and data visualizations using Power Bi that effectively communicated key trends and insights to executive leadership, leading to upgraded business performance by 20%.

Skills: Data Engineer | SSRS | SSIS | SQL Server Analytics Service (SSAS) | Azure Data Factory | Azure Synapse | Azure Blob Storage | Azure Devops | Dynamic SQL | Pyspark SQL | Databricks | Data model | Data Warehouse | Power BI | PLSQL | TSQL

experiences.title: Senior Analyst
experiences.description:
• Designed custom analytical SQL reports using proprietary BI tools like SSRS and Crystal to build parameterized reports , sub-reports, drill through and drill-down reports using SSRS. Shifted Crystal Reports to SSRS Reports before deadlines.
• Architected and implemented a streamlined data warehouse schema, emphasizing well-defined facts and dimensions. Resulted in a 20% reduction in query response time, enhancing system performance.
• Performed data manipulation – cleaning, sorting, transforming – from different sources based on warehousing and reporting requirements. Established control flow tasks and data flow tasks for creating SSIS packages.
• Worked with stakeholders including the Executive, Product, Data, Analytics and Design teams to support their data infrastructure needs while assisting with data-related technical issues to meet different functional/non-functional business requirements.
• Worked and lead multiple teams to assist on building processes that support new and old data initiatives in data architecture, data transformation, data structures, metadata, dependency, and workload management.
• Delivered peer training sessions on Product understanding & development as a Subject Matter Expert in a team of 15. Awarded as ZETA Employee of the year in 2019.
• Led comprehensive financial operations for a property management company, overseeing account receivables, account payables, positive pay, bank reconciliation, and meticulous tie-outs for precise financial reporting and 13% more efficiency.

Skills: Crystal Report | SQL Server Reporting Service (SSRS) | SQL Server Integration Service (SSIS) | TSQL | Subject Matter Expert

accomplishment_projects.title: Instacart Market Basket Analysis
accomplishment_projects.description:
Develop a recommendation system to suggest relevant products to customers based on their previous orders and preferences.

Problems we are going to solve via this project.

Problem 1: Find out hidden association between products for better cross-selling and upselling.
Approach: Implement the Apriori algorithm to identify frequent item sets and generate association rules to find product associations.

Problem 2 : Perform customer segmentation for targeted marketing and anticipate customer behavior.
Approach: Utilize K-means clustering algorithm to group users based on their purchasing patterns for customer segmentation.

Problem 3: Predicting which previously purchased product will be in the user’s next order.
Approach: Using XGBoosting algorithm for product re-order prediction.

Steps Involved:
1. Initial Data Analysis
2. Exploratory Data Analysis
3. Feature Creation
4. Data Preparation
5. Market Basket Analysis
6. Customer Segmentation
7. XGBoost Model
8. Principal Component Analysis

accomplishment_projects.title: Statistical Impact of Tax Rate on Health
accomplishment_projects.description:
This study examines the relationship between restaurant and grocery tax rates and the prevalence of diabetes/obesity, addressing a notable gap in current research. With diabetes/obesity posing a significant global health challenge, understanding the impact of tax policies on food establishments becomes crucial for informed public health interventions. While extensive research has explored various determinants of diabetes/obesity, the specific role of tax rates on these establishments remains largely unexplored. This study aims to contribute to existing knowledge by investigating the potential link between tax policies and diabetes/obesity prevalence, providing insights for policymakers and healthcare professionals. The following sections detail our methodology, regression models, and implications of our findings.

Methods:
1. Data Collection
2. Data Cleaning
3. EDA
4. Multiple Regression Model
5. Model Validation and Assumption

accomplishment_projects.title: Chicago Crime Analysis using Python
accomplishment_projects.description:
The objective of this project is to analyze crime data in Chicago and gain insights into crime patterns, trends, and hotspots. By examining the data, we aim to understand the nature of crime occurrences, identify high-crime areas, and provide recommendations for crime prevention strategies.
This project is created in Python using Flask where user can see dynamic charts based on user selection on Chicago Crimes. This project will allow user to perform exploratory data analysis dynamically based on user selection where user has facility to select any kind of data (latitude and longitude of home and target location) for which they want to see the graph visually. APIs has been created and called dynamically based on user selections.

accomplishment_projects.title: Happiness Prediction Analysis using R Language
accomplishment_projects.description:
I have created a detailed Data Analytics project in R language on top of Kaggle dataset "Happiness Analysis Report of 2021" for estimating the Happiness Score of dystopia region. This report has below modules:
	1. Data Preparation
	2. Data Cleaning
	3. Exploratory Data Analysis
	4. Hypothesis Testing
	5. Co-relation check
	6. Simple Linear Regression Model
        7. Multiple Linear Regression Model
        8. Forward Stepwise Subset Selection Linear Regression Model
        9. Backward Stepwise Subset Selection Linear Regression Model
        10. Model Evaluation Metrics

accomplishment_projects.title: Insurance Management System using JFrame and Oracle SQL
accomplishment_projects.description:
I have created a Insurance Management System where users can purchase multiple policies under multiple insurance types like car, vehicle, travel under one umbrella.
The front end is designed using JFrame and backend is designed in Oracle DB.

Special features of this application:
1. Admin Insights dashboard: In this page, admin can see the trending policy name, number of users using this application, number of policies sold.
2. Verify Users: After the user registers on this application, admin will verify the user then only that user will be able to buy policy on the application.
3. Bill Printing: After buying the policy from this application, the bill will get printed in pdf version.
4. Change Profile Details: Users can change security question and password.

In this application we are performing multiple DB operations like Insert, Update, Delete, Select.
